intro: Psoralea alopecurina, commonly known as the narrow-leaved psoralea, is a small annual herb native to southern Africa. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland and shrubland habitats. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are narrow and often have a glandular surface, which contributes to its characteristic appearance. Psoralea alopecurina is known for its medicinal properties, with various traditional uses reported in indigenous communities.
